text: Lincoln is a town in Middlesex County, Massachusetts, United States. The population was 7,014 at the 2020 census. Lincoln is reportedly the only town in America named after Lincoln, England (and not the Revolutionary War Major General, Benjamin Lincoln or President Abraham Lincoln). Paul Revere was captured by British soldiers in Lincoln on the night of April 18, 1775. ==References== ==Other websites== *Town of Lincoln official website Category:Towns in Massachusetts
title: Lincoln, Massachusetts
